026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets;
027
028import java.util.EnumSet;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Optional;
031import java.util.stream.Stream;
032
033import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
034import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
035import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
036import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
037
038import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.BaseConfiguration;
039import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Content;
040import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Messages;
041import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocFinder;
042import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.Utils;
043import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocFinder.Result;
044
045import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
046import com.sun.source.doctree.ReturnTree;
047import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet.Location;
048
049/**
050 * A taglet that represents the {@code @return} and {@code {@return }} tags.
051 */
052public class ReturnTaglet extends BaseTaglet implements InheritableTaglet {
053
054    public ReturnTaglet() {
055        super(DocTree.Kind.RETURN, true, EnumSet.of(Location.METHOD));
056    }
057
058    @Override
059    public boolean isBlockTag() {
060        return true;
061    }
062
063    @Override
064    public Output inherit(Element owner, DocTree tag, boolean isFirstSentence,
065            BaseConfiguration configuration) {
066        try {
067            var docFinder = configuration.utils.docFinder();
068            var r
069                = docFinder
070                    .trySearch((ExecutableElement) owner,
071                        m -> Result
072                            .fromOptional(extract(configuration.utils, m)))
073                    .toOptional();
074            return r
075                .map(result -> new Output(result.returnTree, result.method,
076                    result.returnTree.getDescription(), true))
077                .orElseGet(() -> new Output(null, null, List.of(), true));
078        } catch (DocFinder.NoOverriddenMethodsFound e) {
079            return new Output(null, null, List.of(), false);
080        }
081    }
082
083    @Override
084    public Content getInlineTagOutput(Element element, DocTree tag,
085            TagletWriter writer) {
086        return writer.returnTagOutput(element, (ReturnTree) tag, true);
087    }
088
089    @Override
090    public Content getAllBlockTagOutput(Element holder, TagletWriter writer) {
091        assert holder.getKind() == ElementKind.METHOD : holder.getKind();
092        var method = (ExecutableElement) holder;
093        Messages messages = writer.configuration().getMessages();
094        Utils utils = writer.configuration().utils;
095        List<? extends ReturnTree> tags = utils.getReturnTrees(holder);
096
097        // make sure we are not using @return on a method with the void return
098        // type
099        TypeMirror returnType
100            = utils.getReturnType(writer.getCurrentPageElement(), method);
101        if (returnType != null && utils.isVoid(returnType)) {
102            if (!tags.isEmpty()
103                && !writer.configuration().isDocLintReferenceGroupEnabled()) {
104                messages.warning(holder, "doclet.Return_tag_on_void_method");
105            }
106            return null;
107        }
108
109        // it would also be good to check if there are more than one @return
110        // tags and produce a warning or error similarly to how it's done
111        // above for a case where @return is used for void
112
113        var docFinder = utils.docFinder();
114        return docFinder
115            .search(method, m -> Result.fromOptional(extract(utils, m)))
116            .toOptional()
117            .map(r -> writer.returnTagOutput(r.method, r.returnTree, false))
118            .orElse(null);
119    }
120
121    private record Documentation(ReturnTree returnTree,
122            ExecutableElement method) {
123    }
124
125    private static Optional<Documentation> extract(Utils utils,
126            ExecutableElement method) {
127        // TODO
128        // Using getBlockTags(..., Kind.RETURN) for clarity. Since @return has
129        // become a bimodal tag,
130        // Utils.getReturnTrees is now a misnomer: it returns only block
131        // returns, not all returns.
132        // We could revisit this later.
133        Stream<? extends ReturnTree> blockTags
134            = utils.getBlockTags(method, DocTree.Kind.RETURN, ReturnTree.class)
135                .stream();
136        Stream<? extends ReturnTree> mainDescriptionTags
137            = utils.getFirstSentenceTrees(method).stream()
138                .mapMulti((t, c) -> {
139                    if (t.getKind() == DocTree.Kind.RETURN)
140                        c.accept((ReturnTree) t);
141                });
142        // this method should not check validity of @return tags, hence findAny
143        // and not findFirst or what have you
144        return Stream.concat(blockTags, mainDescriptionTags)
145            .map(t -> new Documentation(t, method)).findAny();
146    }
147}
